azurerm_dev_test_linux_virtual_machine.description: Manages a Linux Virtual Machine within a Dev Test Lab.

name.description: Specifies the name of the Dev Test Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
notes: The validation requirements for the Name change based on the `os_type` used in this Virtual Machine. For a Linux VM the name must be between 1-62 characters, and for a Windows VM the name must be between 1-15 characters. It must begin and end with a letter or number, and cannot be all numbers.

lab_name.description: Specifies the name of the Dev Test Lab in which the Virtual Machine should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which the Dev Test Lab resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

location.description: Specifies the supported Azure location where the Dev Test Lab exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

lab_subnet_name.description: The name of a Subnet within the Dev Test Virtual Network where this machine should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

lab_virtual_network_id.description: The ID of the Dev Test Virtual Network where this Virtual Machine should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

size.description: The Machine Size to use for this Virtual Machine, such as `Standard_F2`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

storage_type.description: The type of Storage to use on this Virtual Machine. Possible values are `Standard` and `Premium`.

username.description: The Username associated with the local administrator on this Virtual Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

allow_claim.description: Can this Virtual Machine be claimed by users? Defaults to `true`.

disallow_public_ip_address.description: Should the Virtual Machine be created without a Public IP Address? Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

inbound_nat_rule.description: One or more `inbound_nat_rule` blocks as defined below. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
notes: If any `inbound_nat_rule` blocks are specified then `disallow_public_ip_address` must be set to `true`.

notes.description: Any notes about the Virtual Machine.

password.description: The Password associated with the `username` used to login to this Virtual Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

ssh_key.description: The SSH Key associated with the `username` used to login to this Virtual Machine. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
notes: One or either `password` or `ssh_key` must be specified.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

offer.description: The Offer of the Gallery Image. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

publisher.description: The Publisher of the Gallery Image. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

sku.description: The SKU of the Gallery Image. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

version.description: The Version of the Gallery Image. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

protocol.description: The Protocol used for this NAT Rule. Possible values are `Tcp` and `Udp`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

backend_port.description: The Backend Port associated with this NAT Rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

id.description: The ID of the Virtual Machine.

fqdn.description: The FQDN of the Virtual Machine.

inbound_nat_rule.description: One or more `inbound_nat_rule` blocks as defined below.

unique_identifier.description: The unique immutable identifier of the Virtual Machine.

frontend_port.description: The frontend port associated with this Inbound NAT Rule.

create.description: Used when creating the DevTest Linux Virtual Machine.

update.description: Used when updating the DevTest Linux Virtual Machine.

read.description: Used when retrieving the DevTest Linux Virtual Machine.

delete.description: Used when deleting the DevTest Linux Virtual Machine.
